alert.note: Alert for Henry; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rockingham, southwestern Pittsylvania and southeastern Henry Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chatmoss, or near Axton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eden... Wentworth... Mayfield... Axton... Ridgeway... Harrisons Crossroads... and Ruffin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
